ticket.title: Action Controller always renders JS/JSON for XHRs
ticket.original-body:
- Make two templates for an action, one .html.erb and the other .js.erb - Make a get request that will be routed to that action with X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest. - You will always get the .js.erb template, even though request.format will show e.g. text/html. This behaviour is reversed by requesting action/0.html, but not by setting the Accepts: header and use_accepts_header appropriately.
This was observed on an otherwise pristine 2.2 project. On our existing project, it was rendering HTML and then wrapping it in a JSON object, but I haven't looked into that enough.
